common_issues.title: Pieces OS Connection Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties connecting to Pieces OS after the 11.0.4 update. The issue stems from a port change, with the new port being dynamically assigned and documented in the 'com.pieces.os/production/config/.port.txt' file.  Solutions involve verifying the correct port, checking Pieces OS version, and consulting relevant documentation.

related_issues.title: Getting Error: connect ECONNREFUSED 127.0.0.1:1000
related_issues.text:
Getting Error: connect ECONNREFUSED 127.0.0.1:1000
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I tried to include the Pieces OS endpoint (127.0.0.1:1000) into my external project, but even though Pieces OS is operating, I keep getting the error "Connection refused."

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f50f1e1d-4eb2-46a2-9df7-2892ea6d319b)
## Issue Summary

**Key points raised:**

* Raju-git20 encountered an issue with PiecesOS failing to connect after the 11.0.0 update.
* Existing information about similar issues and resources were provided by pieces-support-bot (GitHub Issue #456, #546 and #550).
* It was confirmed that the port has changed to 39300.

**Problems identified:**

* Raju-git20 was unable to connect to PiecesOS using the new port.
* It was clarified that the port used by PiecesOS can range and is dependent on the information provided in the file `com.pieces.os/production/config/.port.txt`.
* However, Raju-git20 confirmed that the port-finding algorithm included within PiecesOS products checks ports starting from 39300.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* It was suggested that Raju-git20 share more about their project to connect Raju with relevant individuals within Pieces for developmental assistance.
* A scheduling link was provided by mark-at-pieces to discuss this further.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Raju-git20's project involves using Python to connect to LinkedIn for job scraping and application processes that are AI-powered.
* A call was scheduled between Raju-git20 and mark-at-pieces to discuss and provide feedback for further development.


**Conciseness and focus:**

The key points, identified problems, and proposed/implemented solutions are highlighted while focusing on the most critical details, including the port change, port-finding algorithm, and scheduled discussion between the user and relevant experts at Pieces.

related_issues.title: Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
related_issues.text:
Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

User reports immediate "Ollama failed to install" diaglog upon clicking install Ollama install button in Pieces desktop app
## Summary of the GitHub issue conversation:

**Key Points:**

* **Problem:** Pieces-OS, installed as a snap, cannot use `curl` and `ollaman` because it runs in a sandbox without access to them. 
* **Solution:** Add `curl` to the snap's dependency list and modify Pieces-OS to work with Ollama within the sandbox environment. 
* **Outcome:** 
    * A fix was committed to a branch, but not yet released. 
    * There has been no further update as of the latest comment on January 28, 2025. 

**Timeline:** 

* **December 18, 2024:** Issue created.
* **December 19, 2024:** Initial troubleshooting and diagnosis of the problem.
* **December 19, 2024:** Confirmation that the issue is related to the snap environment.
* **January 23, 2025:** User confirms the issue persists in the latest version.
* **January 23, 2025:** Developer confirms a fix is in progress.
* **January 28, 2025:** Developer provides an update on progress.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue remains unresolved as of the latest conversation. 
* The user is waiting for an update on the fix.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS High Resource Usage and Startup Issues
common_issues.description: Users report high RAM/CPU usage, sometimes exceeding 5GB, potentially due to memory leaks.  Suggested workarounds include restarting PiecesOS and disabling the Live Context feature.  A potential fix was released in PiecesOS 11.1.0.  Additionally, some users experience issues with PiecesOS or core services not opening, often requiring individual troubleshooting.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
Several users have called in recently about Pieces using too much RAM or causing a spike in CPU up to 100%. We are trying to track down this issue, and would appreciate any feedback about your experience with this if you are experiencing it. 

We have a hunch it has something to do with internet connections, but aren't fully sure yet. 

If you're experiencing this and wouldn't mind hopping on a call with us to show us, we would really appreciate it to help us troubleshoot! You can schedule a call [here](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/0/appointments/schedules/AcZssZ2iaRWpd1kA2k_xg2KrVi_jiTHo0POiMZSI9WAYsxs5jJ9sU2Rd2zKitLuSFd7l3FhatGzy5Vgt
). 

A short-term solution is to restart PiecesOS whenever this occurs. 
## Summary of High Memory Usage Issue in PiecesOS:

**Key Points:**

* High memory usage has been a persistent issue reported by multiple users since April 2024.
* Some users reported memory usage exceeding 5GB, while others experienced high CPU usage.
* The issue was initially attributed to the use of LLMs, but later identified as a potential memory leak.

**Problems Identified:**

* High memory usage impacting user experience and causing system slowdowns.
* The underlying cause of the memory leak was not initially identified.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Optimize Memory feature implemented to unload unused ML models.
* Extensive investigation and release of PiecesOS 11.1.0 with replaced database technologies to address memory and CPU issues.
* Continuous work on further improvements to reduce resource consumption.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* PiecesOS 11.1.0 released with potential fix for memory leak.
* User feedback requested to confirm effectiveness of the update.
* Further improvements planned for future releases.

**Additional Notes:**

* High memory usage may be related to the use of Live Context feature.
* Users experiencing excessive resource consumption encouraged to contact the Pieces team for troubleshooting.

recommendations: **Prioritize Pieces OS Connection Issues:** Allocate additional resources to address the difficulties users face connecting to Pieces OS after the 11.0.4 update. Investigate the root cause of the port change issue and provide clear guidance on port configuration.

**Investigate Pieces Core Services Launch Failures:** Address the issues preventing users from launching Pieces Core Services on Windows and Linux. Prioritize resolving the snap sandbox restrictions on Linux and provide a timely fix. Continue investigating the cause of launch failures on Windows and offer support through live troubleshooting sessions.

**Address PiecesOS High Resource Usage:** Investigate and address the high RAM/CPU usage reported by users, potentially caused by memory leaks. While PiecesOS 11.1.0 includes a potential fix, continue monitoring its effectiveness and explore further optimizations to reduce resource consumption.

**Improve Communication on Known Issues:** Provide clear and timely communication to users regarding the status of known issues, such as the Pieces Core Services launch failures and PiecesOS high resource usage. Offer workarounds and alternative solutions while fixes are being developed.

**Enhance Font Customization Options:** Consider adding a setting to allow users to customize the font in the Pieces Copilot interface, addressing the feedback received regarding font boldness and lack of customization options.

**Review and Update Support Documentation:** Ensure that support documentation, particularly regarding Pieces OS port configuration and troubleshooting core services launch failures, is up-to-date and comprehensive. Provide clear step-by-step instructions and troubleshooting tips.
